Tabrak Remaja Hingga Tewas Di Bali, Wanita Sydney Divonis 3 Bulan Penjara
05 Nov 2019, 14:19 by ABC
Seorang pekerja amal asal Sydney, New South Wales, Australia divonis penjara tiga setengah bulan karena menabrak dan menewaskan seorang remaja Bali dengan mobilnya
Susan Leslie O'Brien, 49 tahun, sudah menjalani dua bulan di balik jeruji besi ketika dia dijatuhi hukuman di pengadilan karena kelalaian mengemudi yang mengakibatkan kematian.
Pengadilan terungkap Susan O'Brien mencoba menyalip sebuah truk di Jembrana, Denpasar, pada 14 Agustus.
Dia menabrak Rizqi Akbar Putra, 19 tahun, yang mengendarai sepeda motor. Dia meninggal di tempat kejadian.
Wanita asal Eastwood itu menghadapi hukuman maksimum penjara enam tahun dan denda Rp12.000.000 ($ 1.235).
Namun, tiga hakim yang mengadili O'Brien memberikan keringanan hukumang mengingat dia tidak memiliki riwayat kriminal sebelumnya, dan memperhitungkan pekerjaannya yang mengajar bahasa Inggris kepada anak-anak setempat.


Susan Leslie O'Brien divonis 3 bulan dan 15 hari penjara. ABC News

Pengadilan juga mengungkap Susan O'Brien telah mencapai sepakat membayar kompensasi kepada keluarga korban dengan jumlah yang tidak diungkapkan yang turut meringankan hukumannya.
Berbicara di pengadilan, Susan O'Brien mengaku menyesal atas kematian pemuda itu.
"Sekali lagi saya meminta maaf atas semua masalah akibat perbuatan saya," katanya.
Setelah dijatuhi hukuman, perempuan 49 tahun itu dikembalikan ke sel tahanan dengan ditemani oleh staf konsuler Australia.
Tidak jelas kapan dia akan dibebaskan, tetapi mengacu pada periode penahanannya diperkirakan dia akan bebas dari penjara sebelum Natal.
Berdasarkan postingan di akun media sosialnya, Susan O'Brien rutin berkunjung ke Bali dan menjalankan pusat pendidikan di sana dan juga seorang pendukung kuat program sterilisasi anjing.
Diterbitkan ulang dari artikel berbahasa Inggris disini.

Crashing into Teenagers to Death in Bali, Sydney Woman Sentenced to 3 Months in Prison
05 Nov 2019, 14:19 by ABC
A charity worker from Sydney, New South Wales, Australia was sentenced to three and a half months in prison for crashing and killing a Balinese teenager in his car
Susan Leslie O'Brien, 49, had spent two months behind bars when she was sentenced in court for negligence in driving which resulted in death.
The trial was revealed Susan O'Brien tried to overtake a truck in Jembrana, Denpasar, on August 14.
He crashed into Rizqi Akbar Putra, 19 years old, who was riding a motorcycle. He died at the scene.
The woman from Eastwood faces a maximum sentence of six years in prison and a fine of Rp 12,000,000 ($ 1,235).
However, the three judges who tried O'Brien gave legal relief considering he had no previous criminal history, and took into account his work teaching English to local children.


Susan Leslie O'Brien was sentenced to 3 months and 15 days in prison. ABC News

The court also revealed Susan O'Brien had reached an agreement to pay compensation to the victims' families with an undisclosed amount that helped ease her sentence.
Speaking in court, Susan O'Brien said she was sorry for the young man's death.
"Once again I apologize for all the problems caused by my actions," he said.
After being sentenced, the 49-year-old woman was returned to a holding cell accompanied by Australian consular staff.
It is unclear when he will be released, but referring to the period of his detention he is expected to be released from prison before Christmas.
Based on posts on her social media accounts, Susan O'Brien regularly visits Bali and runs an education center there and is also a strong supporter of the dog sterilization program.
